title: X Factor: Celebrity: Megan McKenna sobs as she makes finals
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Megan McKenna broken down in tears on X Factor: Celebrity last night after finally getting through to the live shows – 10 years after first auditioning for Simon Cowell.

The star was given her ticket to the live shows after wowing Simon, Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger with her own song Everything But You in a performance at Simon’s Hollywood home.

‘Thank you so much, you don’t understand how much this means to me,’ she told the judges after hearing the good news, breaking down in tears and shaking as she hugged Simon.

‘I’ve wanted this my entire life. So thank you,’ she wept. ‘Sorry. I’m just really happy.’

The star wasn’t lying either, considering in 2009 she made her first-ever appearance on our screens as part of neon-loving duet, Harmony.

Alongside pal Demi, Megan made it through to the semi-finals before falling short. She was briefly introduced into the Towie world as a member of group Lola the following year.

However, despite kicking off a reality career including Ex On The Beach and Celebrity Big Brother, she continued to try and pursue a music career, auditioning twice for X Factor in 2014 and 2015 but never making it past bootcamp.

Megan McKenna burst into tears when she was told she was through (Picture: ITV)

Megan first auditioned for Simon when she was a teenager (Picture: Rex)

In 2017, she combined worlds and set off to start her music career while being followed for reality show There’s Something About Megan.

While her songs weren’t a critical success, they became fan favourites and she ended up supporting Michael Buble in Hyde Park in 2018.

Now, Pete Waterman is declaring her the next Kylie Minogue and a record contract is in her sights.

But first she’ll have to beat the other celebrities vying for the spot – with actor Jonny Labey, Glee’s Kevin McHale and Olivia Olson from Love Actually fame standing alongside her in her category.
